cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.GT, cs.IT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of sampling colorings of a graph, which is a fundamental problem in computer science and statistical physics. The techniques used in the paper involve linear programming and duality arguments, which are commonly used in the areas of algorithms and optimization (cs.DS, cs.CC). The paper also involves analyzing the mixing time of Markov chains, which is a topic in theoretical computer science and probability theory (cs.GT). The paper's focus on analyzing extremal configurations and finding new metrics may also be relevant to information theory (cs.IT) and machine learning (cs.LG).
